problem_text:
If a finitely generated group G has n < ∞maximal subgroups, must G be finite? In particular, what if n = 3?
G. M. Bergman
answer: No, it need not. An example of an infinite group with 3 maximal subgroups is given by a 2-generated 2-LERF group in § 7 of (M. Ershov, A. Jaikin-Zapirain, J. Reine Angew. Math. 677 (2013), 71–134) as its maximal subgroups have index 2.
